00033 #ifndef _MV_MATRIX_COMPLEX_H_
00034 #define _MV_MATRIX_COMPLEX_H_    
00035 
00036 #include "mvvc.h"
00037 #include "mvmrf.h"
00038 
00039 
00040 #include <sstream>
00041 
00042 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00043 #   include <assert.h>
00044 #endif

00046 
00047 class MV_ColMat_COMPLEX
00048 {                                                                      
00049     private:                                                           
00050            MV_Vector_COMPLEX v_;
00051            int dim0_;   // perferred to using dim_[2]. some compilers
00052            int dim1_;   // refuse to initalize these in the constructor.
00053            int lda_;
00054            int ref_;   // true if this is declared as a reference vector,
00055                         // i.e. it does not own the memory space, but 
00056                         // rather it is a view to another vector or array.
00057     public:                                                            
00058                                                                        
00059         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00060         /* Constructors/Destructors */                                 
00061         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                                 
00062                                                                        
00063             MV_ColMat_COMPLEX();                             
00064             MV_ColMat_COMPLEX( int,  int); 
00065 
00066     // some compilers have difficulty with inlined 'for' statements.
00067     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX( int,  int, const COMPLEX&);   
00068 
00069     // usual copy by value
00070     // (can't use default parameter lda=m, because m is not a constant...)
00071     //
00072     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX*,  int m,  int n);
00073     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX*,  int m,  int n,  int lda);
00074 
00075     // the "reference" versions
00076     //
00077     //
00078     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(MV_ColMat_COMPLEX &A, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i);
00079     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX*,  int m,  int n, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i);
00080     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX*,  int m,  int n,  int lda,
00081                 MV_Matrix_::ref_type i);
00082 
00083     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(const MV_ColMat_COMPLEX&); 
00084     ~MV_ColMat_COMPLEX();                              
00085                                                                        
00086         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00087         /*  Indices and access operations */                           
00088         /*::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::*/                           
00089                                                                        
00090     inline COMPLEX&       operator()( int,  int); 
00091     inline const COMPLEX& operator()( int,  int) const; 
00092     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I, const MV_VecIndex &J) ;
00093     const MV_ColMat_COMPLEX operator()(const MV_VecIndex &I, const MV_VecIndex &J) const;
00094      int            dim(int i) const; 
00095      int            lda(void) const{ return lda_; }
00096      int            size(int i) const { return dim(i);} 
00097     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX&        newsize( int,  int);
00098     int ref() const { return ref_;}
00099                                                                        
00100         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00101         /*  Assignment  */                                             
00102         /*::::::::::::::*/                                             
00103                                                                        
00104     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX & operator=(const MV_ColMat_COMPLEX&);
00105     MV_ColMat_COMPLEX & operator=(const COMPLEX&);
00106 
00107 
00108     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const MV_ColMat_COMPLEX &A);
00109 
00110 };                                                                     
00111 
00112 inline COMPLEX& MV_ColMat_COMPLEX::operator()( int i,  int j)
00113 {
00114 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00115     assert(0<=i && i<dim(0));
00116     assert(0<=j && j<dim(1));
00117 #endif
00118     return v_(j*lda_ + i);      // could use indirect addressing
00119                                 // instead...
00120 }
00121 
00122 inline const COMPLEX& MV_ColMat_COMPLEX::operator()
00123                     ( int i,  int j) const
00124 {
00125 #ifdef MV_MATRIX_BOUNDS_CHECK
00126     assert(0<=i && i<dim(0));
00127     assert(0<=j && j<dim(1));
00128 #endif
00129     return v_(j*lda_ + i);
00130 }
00131 
00132 inline MV_ColMat_COMPLEX::MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX* d,  int m, 
00133          int n, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i ):
00134             v_(d,m*n, MV_Vector_::ref), dim0_(m), dim1_(n), lda_(m), ref_(i) {}
00135 
00136 inline MV_ColMat_COMPLEX::MV_ColMat_COMPLEX( MV_ColMat_COMPLEX &A, 
00137                 MV_Matrix_::ref_type i ):
00138                 v_(&A(0,0), A.dim(0)*A.dim(1), MV_Vector_::ref), 
00139                 dim0_(A.dim(0)), dim1_(A.dim(1)), lda_(A.lda()), ref_(i) {}
00140 
00141 inline MV_ColMat_COMPLEX::MV_ColMat_COMPLEX(COMPLEX* d,  int m,  int n,
00142              int lda, MV_Matrix_::ref_type i) :
00143             v_(d, lda*n, MV_Vector_::ref), dim0_(m), dim1_(n), lda_(lda),
00144             ref_(i) {}
00145 
00146 #endif
